newsitem.title: GERMANY: Reuters German Advertising & Media Digest -June 12.
newsitem.headline: Reuters German Advertising & Media Digest -June 12.

text.p: News from Reuters and the German press on Advertising, Marketing, Media, the Internet, Brand-name Products and Consumer Trends

COLOGNE - German hair care giant Wella's fragrance subsidiary Mulhens is launching its fourth Gabriela Sabatini fragrance called Bolero. The German launch is backed by a print and TVcampaign handled by GreCo, Duesseldorf. (Advertising Age)
DUESSELDORF - Ad agency Grey Consell will continue to represent the account of fragrance 4711 by Muelhens, topping competitors Bates, DMB&B, Borsch, Stengel & Partner and Ogilvy & Mather.(Reuter)
FRANKFURT - Ad agency Wirz & Hafner of Frankfurt wins the account of the Deutsche Zentrale fuer Tourismus (German Tourism Headquarters), and will promote the company's Goethe year 1999.(Horizont)

KRONBERG - The German radio market has expanded again this year, with over 80 percent of adults listening to the radioevery day, says the German unit of media marketing company IP. IP says its Annual Media analysis shows 82.5 percent of German over the age of 14 turn on the radio daily, up from 79.8 percent in 1996. (Reuter)

BONN - Multimedia companies will not be required to give customer information to authorities based on an agreement by the ruling coalition on a forthcoming multimedia law. The Interior Ministry had pushed for such a requirement, but the Free Democrats (FDP) blocked it. (Handelsblatt)

BONN - The German government agrees on a draft law that could send air travellers to jail for using mobile telephones, laptop computers, video cameras and a range of other electronic devices in flight. The ban will cover any equipment that could endanger the aircraft by affecting its electronics and communications. Punishment could be a fine or a jail term of up to two years. (Reuter)

BERLIN - Onyx Television, Germany's newest music video channel, says it has reshuffled its management team. Charles Koppel will take over as general manager of Onyx Television GmbH and be based in London and Stuart Pinches has been named company proxy manager for Germany. (Reuter)

BRAND-NAME PRODUCTS & MARKETS: FRANKFURT - Airline Deutsche Lufthansa AG says it will cooperate with French carrier Air Littoral, offering passengers joint flights to destinations in France, Italy and Spain. Lufthansa said, "Air Littoral is a new cooperation partner for Lufthansa." (Reuter)

HAMBURG - Germany's second largest coffee roaster, Tchibo Frisch-Roest-Kaffee GmbH, says it will raise its retail coffee prices on June 26 due to high raw coffee prices and the strong dollar. The company says it will increase its end-user prices by an average of 1.40 marks ($0.82) per kilo. (Reuter)

MUNICH - Daimler-Benz Aerospace AG (DASA) says it expects to follow through with a defence and space partnership with Lagardere even if the French firm's bid for Thomson-CSF fails. "The contents of our memorandum of understanding are binding," says Dasa spokesman Christian Poppe. Dasa, in announcing the pact with Lagardere in May, says it will give its "total and unconditional support for Lagardere's bid to buy Thomson-CSF". (Reuter)

HAMBURG - Industrial group Siemens AG predicts a dramatic turnaround in its rail technology unit in 1998/99, exceeding even the most optimistic analysts' forecasts. Siemens says it expects the transportation technology (VT) unit's 1998/99 sales to reach about six billion marks, up from 4.3 billion marks in 1995/96, which ended last September. (Reuter)
